conclusion: Analyze the image and question to understand the setup of the capacitor and particle motion.

The image shows a parallel-plate capacitor with two horizontal plates separated by distance d. A metal plate with thickness l is placed on the lower plate. A charged particle P is stationary above the metal plate within the capacitor.
The charged particle P is initially stationary above the metal plate within the capacitor.
When the metal plate is quickly removed, the electric field above the plate changes, causing P to accelerate.
The acceleration of P is influenced by the change in electric field and the gravitational acceleration g.
The electric field E between the plates is given by E = V/d, where V is the constant voltage applied.
The force on the particle due to the electric field is F = qE, where q is the charge of the particle.
The acceleration a of the particle is given by a = F/m - g, where m is the mass of the particle.
Substituting the expressions for F and g, we get a = qV/md - g.
The question provides that the acceleration is 1/2g, so we have qV/md = 3/2g.
Solving for a, we find a = 1/2g.
